thread.title: Free case of wine worth £50 when you book a 2016 tour offer - Terms and Conditions
thread.title_full: Free case of wine worth £50 when you book a 2016 tour offer - Terms and Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Free case of wine worth £50 when you book a 2016 tour offer - Terms and Conditions
text: To be eligible for mixed case of wine you must book a tour departing in 2016 and Quote: your unique subscriber number and the promotion code SUBTOUR16. One case per booking. You must make the booking between 00.01 on 08.10.15 and 23.59 on 07.01.16. Any bookings made after this time and date will not be eligible for a a complimentary case of wine. The case will be sent to the lead name on the booking on or around the 11.01.16 and will be sent to the postal address given after your booking confirmation has been sent to you. (Note: We cannot guarantee delivery before customers' departure due to delivery timelines by mailing service providers). Promotion only applies to UK residents aged 18 and over. All bookings are subject to Riviera's booking conditions. Employees of Riviera Travel, Telegraph Media Group and its group of companies, their agents and families are not permitted to take part in this promotion. There is no cash alternative and the voucher is non-transferable. There is no limit to the number of bookings that can be made under this offer. Cannot be used in conjunction with any other offer. Booking must be made over the phone on 0333 0059 008 to comply with offer, bookings made by travel agents or partner sites do not qualify for the voucher. Travel insurance not included. Calls from a landline or mobile are charged at a local rate. Image used in conjunction with Riviera Travel. Fax: 01283 742301, email: telegraph@rivieratravel.co.uk, ABTA V4744 ATOL 3430 protected. All holidays are operated by, and your resulting contract and booking conditions will be with, Riviera Travel (registered in England No. 1869298), a company wholly independent of TMG Ltd. Refer to the Data Protection Notice in today’s Personal Column. @telegraph
